abstract: Power failures occur across wide swaths of Washington and parts of suburban Maryland after conductor fails on electrical line operated by Pepco, main utility serving city.
lead_paragraph: The power failure was traced to a substation in suburban Charles County in Maryland, where a conductor fell on the ground and started a fire, the authorities said.

headline.main: A Short-Lived Power Failure in Washington Causes a Brief Government Shutdown
headline.print_headline: A Short-Lived Power Failure in Washington Causes a Brief Government Shutdown

snippet: The power failure was traced to a substation in suburban Charles County in Maryland, where a conductor fell on the ground and started a fire, the authorities said.
